title: Mission Description
content: Finally, the trailblazing expedition onPenaconyhas come to a preferable conclusion. It's time for a new adventure — but before that, the Crew would like to wish say a formal farewell to certain people.Drawing a firm line under the stories of those who passed is the best form of comfort. Go on, then — they're all at theDreamflux Reef... right here.

speaker: Acheron
line: When I arrived, I happened to see a child holding it. He said the flowers were prepared by Aunt Jessie, for the Watchmaker, and the war comrade he'd missed his whole life.

speaker: Acheron
line: Mikhail would place two bunches of flowers here year after year. And, after he left, it became three.

speaker: Acheron
line: Your wishes will always be remembered by someone.

speaker: Acheron
line: Now, Penacony as you hoped, has welcomed the dawn after a long, dark night. The path forward may not be a bed of roses, but at least people are prepared to step forth towards freedom.

speaker: Acheron
line: Tiernan, you can now go home.

speaker: Acheron
line: While the Nameless are also preparing for the next stop of their voyage.

speaker: Himeko
line: But before leaving, we still have one last thing to do.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: It is my honor. I've said many goodbyes. Yet I am glad, that this is the first time I speak those words with a smile.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: But before leaving, I'm sure you all have plenty to say to the Nameless of the past?

text: We've come to say goodbye to Gallagher.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: Looks like you've also noticed that history fictionologist is nowhere to be found in Penacony, disappearing just as quietly as when he first showed up.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: I believe he must have come here at the end, to bid farewell to his Nameless friends. Similarly, I'm sure you all have plenty you want to say to them.

text: We've come to say goodbye to the old Nameless.

speaker: Acheron
line: A fitting end to the tale of the departed — one could not ask for a better farewell. Go on, they're all here.

text: Say goodbye to Tiernan and Razalina

speaker: Acheron
line: A fitting end to the tale of the departed — one could not ask for a better farewell. Go on, they're all here.

text: (Upon bidding farewell to Tiernan and Razalina)

speaker: March 7th
line: Honestly, when I heard the conductor 's request, I was pretty surprised.

speaker: March 7th
line: The Nameless — Those who Trailblaze , doing good deeds but never seeking recognition. After all this time, how would we even find those three people in such a vast place like Penacony?

speaker: March 7th
line: But it seems... in the Land of the Dreams, anything is indeed possible.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: History may not remember the names of the dead, but the stars will attest to their journeys.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The first glimmer of light in the prolonged night often illuminates little, as it is fleeting and the darkness too vast.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But because of this, people will remember: As long as something shines in the night sky, then when the first star falls... countless more will follow, streaking across the horizon.

text: (If Bitter Dreams / Drowning Sweetness was mixed)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Breukelen Tiernan, Razalina Jane Estella, we raise a toast to you, Trailblazers of the silver rail...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...A toast to history that no longer remains silent, the passionate and courageous pursuit, and a voyage that traverses the stars.

speaker: March 7th
line: That statue... It wasn't here last time.

speaker: Himeko
line: Looks like this is the last riddle that Mr. Gallagher left for us.

speaker: Himeko
line: In the end, we still failed to figure out his true identity, or if he was even a "living person."

speaker: March 7th
line: What should I say... I mean this guy is definitely a history fictionologist all right. I'm suddenly reminded of the time at the theme park when he said he was only thirteen years old. Could that have meant something, too?

speaker: March 7th
line: Either way, he's an "enigmatic" character for sure.

speaker: March 7th
line: At least our journey together in Penacony was real enough, and his loyalty and love for this land... must have been real too, right?

text: (If Bitter Dreams / Drowning Sweetness was mixed)

speaker: March 7th
line: Gallagher, we raise a toast to you, the slumbering Hound...

speaker: March 7th
line: ...To the festival's invitation, to all lies, and the singular truth...

speaker: March 7th
line: ...If we ever meet again, please don't talk in riddles.

speaker: Micah
line: Is the Astral Express ready to depart Penacony?

speaker: Welt
line: Apologies, Mr. Micah, that we are only now bidding you farewell.

speaker: Micah
line: Oh, that's alright. You've all done so much for the Watchmaker, and we are forever indebted. Allow me, as the representative of Dreamflux Reef, to make another toast to all the Nameless.

speaker: Welt
line: What will the people of Dreamflux Reef do now?

speaker: Micah
line: Many will continue to live here. Those accustomed to being awake will mostly have a hard time getting used to a life of darkness with their eyes closed. Though the Order has faded, there must be someone to watch over this primal Memory Zone.

speaker: Micah
line: Penacony's nights are long, and there are many who are still far from a good night's sleep. As for the sweet dream over there...

speaker: Micah
line: We're still managing without it, aren't we?

text: (If Bitter Dreams / Drowning Sweetness was mixed)

speaker: Welt
line: Micah, and residents of Dreamflux Reef, we raise a toast to you, watchers of the long dream...

speaker: Welt
line: ...To your tenacity throughout time, to each sorrowful night, and to the dawn that is finally upon us.

speaker: Himeko
line: In the end, we still came full circle.

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ This Trailblazing expedition started from the moment (Trailblazer) and a bellboy ran into each other. After going on a journey of many twists and turns, they still ended up where they started.

speaker: Himeko
line: Just like a clock's hands that turn round and round, the start and end of each day will always land on twelve o'clock — the advent of time moving forward.

speaker: Himeko
line: There shouldn't be much left to say. This entire adventure started because of you, and should naturally end with you.

speaker: Himeko
line: And then, a new page will be turned.

text: (If Bitter Dreams / Drowning Sweetness was mixed)

speaker: Himeko
line: Mikhail Char Legwork, we raise a toast to you, Watchmaker of the Land of the Dreams, Nameless of the Astral Express...

speaker: Himeko
line: ...To Penacony's past, present, future... and the child's unwavering dream unto death.

speaker: March 7th
line: With that, our duty as Nameless should be complete... right?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Trailblaze can illuminate the way, but ultimately, the future of a world belongs to those who live in it.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...I still feel that Mr. Mikhail must have really wanted to witness this day himself.

speaker: Himeko
line: What's on your mind, March?

speaker: March 7th
line: Just a strange feeling. I had it a few stops ago, but it's super strong this time.

speaker: Welt
line: Why not talk about it? Maybe everyone's thinking the same thing?

speaker: March 7th
line: ...I can't help but think that whether it's Mr. Mikhail, Mr. Tiernan, or Madam Razalina, their lives must have been long, and they must have experienced plenty of stories...

speaker: March 7th
line: They were also young once, stumbling and bumbling around just like us, getting into scraps and mischief, that sort of stuff. Companions, enemies, journeys, adventures, all the sad and happy memories... The "every day" that we're used to, they've lived through them too.

speaker: March 7th
line: But those things... are all in the past.

text: Time will wash everything away... so treasure the present.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I know, but the thing that I can't get out of my mind... is the present.

text: One day, our stories will also be a part of past.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Yeah, maybe that's the precise thing I can't let go of...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: It's rare that I'm this serious, can't you just humor me for once? Sheesh!

speaker: March 7th
line: It'll be easier to understand if I use an analogy: Like when you're reading a book, if one of its characters keeps running into obstacles, and experiences an ending full of regrets, we're bound to feel a bit mixed about it, right?

text: I could understand, but I'd feel mixed too.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Because we've seen every nook and cranny of their lives, we see these people as special.

text: No matter what, that's very hard to accept.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Because we've seen every nook and cranny of their lives, we see these people as special.

text: You won't be affected as long as you don't live vicariously through them.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: To me, it's because we've seen every nook and cranny of their lives, we see these people as special.

speaker: March 7th
line: So even if there are parts of it that aren't really realistic nor logical, we still hope that their story gets a good ending when it comes.

speaker: March 7th
line: But what if they... and we... aren't really that special?

speaker: March 7th
line: When Mr. Mikhail sat in this chair, waiting for the Astral Express to arrive every day, what was he thinking? And if, at the end of his life, he could still firmly say he had no regrets...

speaker: March 7th
line: Then, what is this regret we feel in our hearts right now...?

speaker: Himeko
line: I think, each and every one of us is searching for the answer to this very question.

speaker: Himeko
line: The universe is vast, and our lives are but specks. The Trailblaze never ends, but against the backdrop of the cosmos, the average person's lifelong journey is merely a short stretch.

speaker: Himeko
line: But it is in this miniscule distance that paths cross, and countless worlds connect. The universe may not remember every person who leaves a tie along the silver rail, but we will.

speaker: Himeko
line: As long as we remember, their stories will never end.

speaker: Himeko
line: And what Mr. Mikhail has left for us is his answer to this very question. It may not be perfect, but it left a smile on this storied, jaded old Nameless' face at the end of his life.

speaker: Himeko
line: And its meaning will be interpreted by those who come after — us.

speaker: March 7th
line: It's not the answer that's important, but what we can learn from others' answers... right?

speaker: Himeko
line: This is what Trailblazing is.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Sure.

speaker: March 7th
line: I'm really sorry for bringing down the vibe! Quick, Dan Heng, tell us a dad joke to lighten the mood!

speaker: Welt
line: It's never a bad thing to reflect. One day, we'll all have to face our own farewells.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But before that, we still have a long way ahead of us together.

speaker: Himeko
line: So the most important thing right now is to tell the conductor what we saw in Penacony.

speaker: Himeko
line: Then prepare ourselves for our next Trailblazing destination.

title: Step Description
content: Now that the dust has finally settled, a new trailblazing expedition is about to begin.Go back to the Astral Express, collect your thoughts, and prepare yourself — for a new adventure.
